Web Security

How would you advise a potential client to secure his/her website from web security attacks? Note: the word count for your answer should not be greater than 250 words

- Be aware of the most common forms of attack and counter-measures:
- Cross-site scripting
- SQL injection
- Cross-site request forgery
- Clickjacking
- Denial of Service (DoS)
- Directory Traversal
- File inclusion
- Command Injection

- Utilize web security best practices:
- Sanitation of data
- Secure authorization and authentication
- Use well reknowned third-party application
- Continuous Deployment/Continuous Integration (CD/CI)
- Network security
- Implementation of automatic user timeout

Also consider all or several of the following strategies:
1 Include everyone in security practices - Utilize SecDevOps practice, and make all employees have security in mind when making key decisions
2 Adopt a cyber security framework - Research security risks and develop cyber incident response plan
3 Automate and integrate security tools - Use CI/CD platforms and/or issue trackers
4 Follow secure software development practices- Make sure software developers are educated about potential security problems. Scan for security problems as early as possible in the dev. lifecycle
5 Use diverse security measures - Ie. penetration testing, vulnerability scanning, DAST/IAST/SAST testing, WAF...
6 Perform security exercises - Perform continuous security exercises/mock attacks ie. red team vs blue team
7 Maintain a bounty program - Hire outside freelancers to test your security
